content:
courtesy of the U.S PERIOD Department of State

Joseph DiCristofaro Student ReporterMarch  

The chance to study abroad has become easier for five Marshall University students who were awarded a  scholarship to put toward internship programs or studying abroad PERIOD

Students Cynthia Collins Chandreonia Harris Juliana Hernandez Leanasha Jones and Walker Tatum received the U.S PERIOD Department of States Benjamin A PERIOD Gilman Scholarship PERIOD Over  U.S PERIOD undergraduate students were awarded the scholarship in December PERIOD

Tatum has already put forth his scholarship funds to support a 10day winter program in Italy over Marshalls winter break PERIOD

It was a rigorous program but a good balance of learning and fun Tatum said PERIOD

While in Florence and Rome Tatum studied arts chemical components and the chemicals needed to preserve art PERIOD The program was led by Marshall faculty member Dr PERIOD Rosalynn QuinonesFernandez PERIOD

Collins meanwhile will go to Argentina this spring with the program led by Dr PERIOD Shawn Schulenberg PERIOD Lastly Hernandez is eligible to win the Critical Need Language Award as she will be spending a full academic year at the Kansai Gaidai University in Japan PERIOD

Harris and Jones on the other hand will travel to Japan and Korea over the summer for the JapanKorea Pop program led by Dr PERIOD Zelideth Rivas assistant provost for global education and modern languages professor PERIOD

The Gilman scholarship has awarded  students since  with over half of the recipients being from small or rural towns and  demonstrating financial need PERIOD

Your donation will help continue the work of independent student journalism at Marshall University PERIOD If you benefit from The Parthenons free content please consider making a donation PERIOD
